column13: The menu is wonderful everything looked so delicious it was hard to decide. I will definitely go there again next time I visit Roanoke. I went for lunch so can't speak on how the bar scene is but I did make note they had great drink specials.
Ordered their 525 Salad with grilled chicken - it was ok, but wholly unremarkable.
Best chop house in Charlottesville and has been for years
the reservation made via opentable wasa not on record. however, they accommodated my party.
We had a wonderful dinner and highly recommend it to others

Great food. Excellent service. My only complaint is that when making the reservation on Open Table, I requested a quiet spot to celebrate a romantic occassion. Instead, we were seated at the end of a long booth directly in front of the drink station.
The food & service was amazing!!
Loved the food (particularly the half-portion option) and the Cherry Crepe specialty drink. The experience provided just the right amount of everything for this diner.

We celebrated New Year’s Eve at Art Café 26 – it was our first visit to the establishment in New Town area of Williamsburg, and the every aspect of the dinner, the entertainment, and the service was superb. The café itself is small but with the European flair resembling a living room filled with art. The 10-course menu designed by a very talented young chef Klinger was spread over several unhurried hours – the food and the presentation was exquisite. There was a wonderful selection of wines providing an excellent pairing with the food presented. We decided to definitely visit this restaurant and would recommend it to our friends when in the area. Kudos to Ms. Sibilla Dengs the owner of Art Café 26 who made our New Year’s Eve very special.
we had a wonderful meal and the atmosphere was perfect.Would definitely recommend it and look forward to going back
Very good food, and very good service. It was a little noisy to be considered romantic. We will definately return on another special occasion.

I cannot think of a better dining experience in Charlottesville than I had at Bella's. Our reservation for for 6:45 and when we arrived at 6:45 our table was ready and waiting. We were seated at a table for two against the wall, which was of original brick. The ceiling is the original tin patterned material so popular at the turn of the last century. These features along with old photographs on the walls add to the ambiance. It is the food however that makes Bella's stand out. We ordered the bruschetta as an appitizer.It was the best bruschetta I've ever had; every ingredient was evident in every bite. The Pasta al Forno was our main course and was simply exceptional. Great service, great food, and good wine make bella's a winner.
dinner was quite expensive. Food was good. decor was pretty outdated. The waiter was excellant.

Our waitress was outstanding. I do not remember her name but she was very pleasant and helpful. We brought our infant to dinner, which made us a little nervous, but she set our minds at ease by being so nice to us.

Enjoyed the duck but the highlight of the evening was a wonderful pheasant special with a lovely juniper sauce in vegetables. Warm bread and recommended white wine topped off the meal. Neighboring table was a bit loud for this small restaurant.(Who really discusses the merits of Chick Fillet at a French restaurant?). Richard was an attentive waitstaff and enjoyedMeeting Wendy and discussed upcoming events we will not want to miss. Overall, an enjoyable experience. We will be back.
Excellent food. Delicious and beautifully presented.

Excellent food and a complimentary wine tasting on the second wednesday of every month with half off bottles in the tasting. Overall my wife and I had a really great experience and the food, service, and beverages were top notch.
Lovely evening. Love that we can make reservations for Ionly 2 people. Thank you.

This was our second experience dining at Bookbinder's and it was just as enjoyable as the first. The food and service was outstanding. Bookbinder's is where we will go for special occasions in the future.

Outstanding service, menu with good variety, very traditional European cuisine with a few local/southern touches. Quiet dining upstairs with traditional decor, dark colors. Nothing too fancy or modern. Prices are a bit on the expensive side of 'fair' for dishes served. Complimentary amuse bouche is always a welcome treat.

The food was relatively good but WAY MORE PRICEY than it was worth. We made a reservation & it was honored right away, so that was nice but, again, the brunch buffet was NOT worth the price & the menu they offered was in no way enticing. We won't return.

It's been over 10 years since I had been to Buckheads and everything I could remember held true. Great service, incredible food, and nice atmosphere. Their wine list is impressive. It's no secret that all this comes at a handsome price, but it's hard to match the quality that you get.
The Veal Saltimboca, Italian Cobb Salad, the soup; Pasta Fazule, and the Fish and pasta dishes shared by all was outstanding. Everything was absolutely delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant!

column4: 741 First Colonial Rd Suite 107 Virginia Beach, VA  23451
column13: We always enjoy our experience when we go to Burton's. We love the people, we love the food, we love that we have a wonderfully kid friendly place to go. Thank you.

This was our second visit to Byrd and Baldwin Bros. We went for an early valentine's dinner. Overall our experience was just "ok". The steaks were excellent - both cooked perfectly - but the mashed potatoes were gummy and tasted like they had been sitting under a heating lamp for a while. Spinach salad was way overdressed and soggy. Service was fair given that it was not that crowded. For the price of the food I expect alot better.

First time at C=Street for dinner. Service was good. Music too loud. 4 of 5 liked their entree choice: crab cakes, mahi mahi..... but the lamb chops were greasy without much taste. Earlier lunch visits were excellent, so will try again.
We've been looking for a favorite restaurant in Williamsburg, and now I think it's Cafe Provencal!

My wife, grad student daughter and I most certainly enjoyed Camino. The service, ambience, and good conversation was all a joy--and the food was spectacular. The paella was delicious--a tasty blend, not overpowering, with seasoning that amplified rather than dominated. The fennel appetizer was a force of nature--it was so wonderful we wanted it as soup. As well, the wine choices were perfect for the food and the setting--an excellent selection fairly priced. We very much enjoyed the restaurant and will certainly visit again.

column4: 4001 Church Point Rd Virginia Beach, VA  23455
column13: Top notch dining. Flavor-full, pleasing dishes, Victorian Castle atmosphere, great service. We will be coming back once a week!

The food and service wasn't what it has been in my previous visits. I've always loved the shrimp and grits but the pickled vegetables added to the top kinda ruined in, thankfully they were pushed off to the side easily. The appetizer--fried green tomatoes-was excellent. The ambiance is still lovely and so I enjoyed my birthday meal overall pretty well.
The service staff works as a unified team and they are always superb!

column4: 5294 Fairfield Shopping Center Virginia Beach, VA  23464
column13: It seems there were only 2 chefs and four tables waiting to be served, so they seemed as though they were very rushed. The decor was...no comment. They had space heaters in the establisment.

First off with this restaurant the only way you will get into the door if you have a reservation. With having to make the reservation I was expecting the restaurant be a bit more up scale. The restaurant was very noisy and very small. I was expecting the the same atmosphere as there other restaurant Create. A place were you wanted to spend your Anniversary at. But instead I felt like I was at a bar. We were sat at a very small table for two, were you didn't feel like you had much room. To give you a example the table would only had enough room for you dinner plates and nothing else. We only got to our drinks and a appetizer before we decided to go to a different restaurant in Williamsburg.

While we have eaten at Clifton for years including the chef table and wine cellar, I was most embarrassed to bring two new people, good friends from Waynesboro, on this night. It was packed, service good, but fish not cooked enough to eat and not worth even 50% off as each couple paid 160. wish it had been a different experience for sure.

column4: 1427 North Great Neck Road Virginia Beach, VA  23454
column13: My overall favorite. Outstanding everytime.

column4: 1624 Laskin Road Suite 762 Virginia Beach, VA  23451
column13: The chef's approach to pairing new foods together was refreshing. My Scallops Rockefeller appetizer was amazing. The Caprese Salad with Fried Green Tomatoes was over the top good. Our entre's were delectable and the Creme Brûlée Sampler was the perfect way to finish up a wonderful experience.
We attended the "He said/She said" beer and wine review. It was fabulous. It was awecome that I was able to sample so many beers and wines with each course. I would recommend to anyone and everyone!

column1: Crossings Restaurant, Bar & Lounge - Westin Richmond
column13: The restaurant was great about accomodating our dietary restrictions and gave my husband his own V-Day dessert so we didn't have to share. They even gave all the women a single red rose to celebrate the holiday. It was a nice touch.

column1: The Dining Room at the Berkeley Hotel
column13: Was a wonderful evening! The food and service were great....just top notch! However, the music choice of 70's and 80's rock just did not fit the ambiance of the restaurant. Try some classical music for a more relaxing atmosphere.
management and staff were very friendly and the evening went quite well......i'll be back!.....bernie martin

I ordered soup of day and BLT sandwich. Soup was not as hot as it should be. BLT was actually a triple decker sandwich which I do not like. Didn't see indications on menu that it was triple decker. Basically, it made it awkward to eat and was more than I desired. Waitress was great and ambiance was very good. We like the location.
Terrific and different food. Service was off a bit for some reason.

column1: Eurasia Cafe & Wine Bar - Virginia Beach
column13: A must try!! Creative twists on foods, intimate space, waitstaff great.... Go today!!

column1: Eurasia Cafe and Wine Bar - Richmond
column13: I particularly enjoy the beet carpaccio on a regular basis. A real bonus this time was the vegetarian lasagna. Although I am not a vegetarian, I prefer vegetarian lasagna and this was delicious. I hope it will go on the regular menu soon.

The appetizers were exceptional, as well as the service. The entre was lacking some flavor but still very good. Overall my date and I had a good/great experience. I would recomend the resturaunt to a friend.

column4: 3150 William Styron Square Newport News, VA  23606
column13: Excellent service and food quality. Wait time for appetizers and entrees was very low. You have to try the crab dip. All food was not overwhelming on spices used, excellent taste. Decor was very nicely done. Wine list is one of the largest I have seen.

column4: 943 J Clyde Morris Blvd Newport News, VA  23601
column13: always excellent. We go there regularly and are never disappointed. Great staff

column4: 1253 Nimmo Parkway Suite 117 Virginia Beach, VA  23454
column13: Over all great place to dine. Friend staff and great food made of a great experience. The self serve wine and beer bar was also a cool feature that I would like to go back and checkout.

The filet was outstanding. The flounder was undercooked and the crab had too much filler. Would definitely go back and order the filet again but not the flounder. Very nice atmosphere. Service was slow but we weren't in a hurry.

column4: 9200 Stony Point Parkway Suite 131 Richmond, VA  23235
column13: Excellent choice for any occasion.

column4: Keswick Hall at Monticello 701 Club Drive Keswick, VA  22947
column13: Elegant and romantic way to spend an anniversary. They wrote "Happy Anniversary" on our dessert plate of Margherita Semifreddo - in chocolate sauce! A complementary champagne toast and excellent service made for a beautiful evening.

Attentive service, nice bar, good drinks.We had a reservation at 8 pm, did not get seated until at least 8:30, they covered some of our bar tab (nice) but our friends had already paid for drinks.The waiter was great and friendly and relaxed. The upstairs was way too hot. Even after taking off my sweater it was uncomfortable. The appetizers were okay, nothing really special. The entrees were just average. I had the pork chop and it was dry. The scallops were fine, but really nothing to get excited about. My friend liked his sea bass. Pretty expensive for the quality of the food. Will be interesting to see if they make it. I think they will, as the interior design on the first floor is really great and the bar is a super place to drink.

The serbice was very good. My partner has the egg plant parm and said it was very good. I had a greek sampler and found it good, but not great. It was quiet, not super busy, clean and nicely decorated.
We had not been to the Tavern in awhile. It was a decent meal, not exceptional.
love it best service in richmond

The staff and level of service at Harper's Table is just what you are looking for. Attentive, but not to intrusive. They offer a good wine selection and the food is superb! The chef specials are always a great surprise.

column4: 4120 Cox Rd. Suite B Glen Allen, VA  23060
column13: All in all the food was excellent. I ordered a filet mignon and liked my meat cooked well done. Most places I have been to, never get it right, usually leaving it very rare in the center. Hondos not only cooked it correctly, but the waiter had me check the filet to make sure it was cooked to my satisfaction. I was very impressed with that.
Waitress was excellent and food was well prepared
The best dinner I have ever had
Isabella's was amazing as always. The food was absolutely delicious & the service was fantastic!
We eat here 2or3 times a year for special occasions and have never been disappointed. The food is always outstanding and the servers are always professional and attentive without being obtrusive.
Service was slow and the food was poor,much better places to eat in Williamsburg.

From our view, easily the best in Harrisonburg, Virginia. Service is absolute tops: attentive, friendly, knows the menu backwards and forwards. Joshua Wilton House is and will remain our "go-to" place for special occasions.
Service was excellent!! Only down side was that they were out of calamari but everything else was excellent

column4: 11221 West Broad Street Glen Allen, VA  23060
column13: The atmosphere was comfortable and made for a wonderful evening. The wait staff were very knowledgeable about the menu and offered many suggestions for both our meals and drinks. Overall it was very pleasant and with good music, good food, and good people.
Always fabulous and authentic Italian food and wonderful service as well.
The service was okay but my food was not.

We stopped in on a Friday night and were so pleasantly surprised. The food was outstanding. My husband had the duck breast which had a delicious glaze and I had the perfectly cooked tuna special. We saved some room for dessert crepes...you won't find a dessert this good anywhere in Richmond! We could have shared one but we had enough to take home and have the next morning for breakfast (tsk, tsk!). Best of all, the owner, Ali, was incredibly friendly and visited with us during our meal. Straight from Paris, he has done a great job with a downtown location. I suspect the lunch crowd is huge. The dinner crowd was small and quiet, making it a perfect place for a romantic dinner where we didn't have to yell to carry on a conversation.
Everything was fantastic, thank you!
Le Yaca is an excellent French restaurant. Very good food, friendly service, and nice atmosphere. Definitely on the pricier side, but a nice place for a date night.

column4: Short Pump Town Center 11800 West Broad Street, Suite 910 Richmond, VA  23233
column13: My wife and I have been looking for a GOOD Indian Restaurant and we finally found an EXCELLENT one but alas, it is 215 miles from our home in NC. The lunch we had made the drive worth while as did our visit to the VIRGINIA MUESEUM of FINE ARTS which, is the reason we were in Richmond.Whenever we get near Richmond we will make it a point to stop at Lehja. Also, they are located in an outstanding Open Mall Shopping Center as well.

Prie fixe dinner was an excellent value, as was the wine-pairing. Waitress made excellent suggestions, but we were able to order any house wines. Both of us opted to take her recommendations and were happy that we did. I would have rated food as outstanding, but I did not care for the chocolate bread pudding.

The Chop House is one of my favorite places to eat in Harrisonburg. Two out of town business colleagues were very impressed and talked about it for days. The building is a comfortable space that feels just right- nice but not too fancy; quiet enough for converstaion but not dull. Beer choices were very good and we enjoyed the local Three Brothers Double IPA. Food was excellent starting with interesting salads and a wonderful home made sweet potato soup that was surprisingly light had very interesting flavors. My guests had ribeye steaks - one locally raised special and the other a normal menu item (because they were out of the special) and I had scallops. Service was very good all cooked to perfection. I recommend a visit.

column1: Local Roots - A Farm to Table Restaurant
column13: My husband and I had dinner at Local Roots for my birthday. I had never had the opportunity to enjoy a chef's tasting menu and noticed that they offered one... so we tried their 7 course offering. Honestly, it was exquisite. Each item was beautifully prepared, amazingly flavorful and the variety - well, we had an amazing two and half hours of exploring tastes and textures and talking and... it was just lovely. I had the wine pairing with my meal, my husband did not. Truly enjoyed their offerings, I am not a connoisseur so the explanations were enjoyed and appreciated. The wait staff is quite knowledgeable and professional. We live in San Diego and I am hard pressed to name a restaurant here that I think is as good as Local Roots.

The restaurant is older and in need of a face lift. The staff was polite, but overall service was just average. The prices were high for the value in my opinion. I would not recommend based on my experience.
Enjoyed a great crabcake dinner. Nice ambiance, great service. Nice wine selection and martino was well done.Definitely worth a visit.
Last time for awhile. Service was better this time, but everything else is strictly average. Food is not warm and average quality. Not recommended

column1: Mahi Mah's Seafood Restaurant and Sushi Saloon
column13: The Server Nigel was great,he explained the food very well and had a great personality, the food was excellent, cooked perfect, fresh, great, great tast and product. Was very pleased.
Great meal. The sea bass was excellent. Enjoyed the ambiance and local flavor. The staff was friendly and courteous.
our server was amazing her food and drink reccomendations were superb!! the ambiance was romantic yet upbeat and the food was delicious. This is the PERFECT date night location
Service was rushed, food was overpriced
The experience was awesome. The waiter was awesome.

The Melting Pot is a great, romantic restaurant. Whether it is your first date, anniversary or special occasion, the place feels like it is just you and your partner. I like how they changed the menu and makes it much easier to customize your order.

column4: 1564 Laskin Road, Suite 182 Virginia Beach, VA  23451
column13: The food, service, and atmosphere of the melting pot is WONDERFUL. It is very pricy,and there isn't much food, but the food that's there is delicious, and perfect. It's a novelty and I'd only recommend it for special occasions due to the price.
Food was great, service was extremely slow

column4: 1860 Laskin Road Suite 115B Virginia Beach, VA  23454
column13: This is the best Japanese restaurant we have tried in Tidewater. Fun new decor, and the Sushi bar is a blast to watch.

From the moment my date and I entered we were treated as if we were the only people in the restaurant. They tailored the entire experience to our specific expectations and really made us feel special. Associates of mine who had previously dined at this establishment warned me of the great expense however, taking in account he caliber of the food, the portion size, the wine selection, attention to detail and level of service I'd have to say I would have gladly paid double. The atmosphere was nice , not the most romantic, but I really enjoyed the opened view of the kitchen and the sharpness of the design and the appearance of the wait staff. I would highly recommend Morton's to anyone who enjoys MAGNIFICENT food and BRILLIANT service.
I have been to Mosaic many times but this visit was very disappointing.
We make regular trips to enjoy Indian cuisine, and Nawab never disappoints!
nawab is a great place anytime. The food, service, and ambiance is always top notch.
"I love the relaxed feel, saver was polite and helpful. The food was Delicious .

We have been there many times. The food, service, special occasion's or anytime have always been a 5 star if not more experience. We booked my husband's 70th birthday and "sweet heart"day there just last week.

It was great. The waiter was a unprofessional by calling me nick name like "guy, boss" I am a chef and the food was great just the waiter was not up to par and also the waiter kept touching my guest and I every time he came to check on out foor or drinks.

column4: 2109 West Great Neck Road  Suite 102 Virginia Beach, VA  23451
column13: Great Place. The sun sets over the water here. Fantastic spot for a date at sunset...
Excellent dining adventure! All aspects were what we expected. One of the best filets I've ever eaten. Wait staff was the best and very attentive. We'll be back.
We enjoyed getting to know our "food mates" at our seating... Diner there is always not only about the food, but also the "show" that is part of the chef's routine! We had a great time!

We move a lot and lived in the area about 4 years ago. We were fortunate enough to dine here several years ago and were happy to see they were still in the neighborhood. We introduced another couple to Pasha Mezze and they loved it as much as we did.
The food and service were good, but it is over priced for the area.
Great Food and Great cocktails!

I think that the overall intention was well but the execution needed work the host made us wait for quite some time for an extremely inconvenient location when there was at least 3 empty tables so I had to refuse that table. Once seated my wife observed that all of the staff seemed nervous as if they weren't trained efficiently but although it took a long time for appetizers and the first course I think the waiter wasn't bad. I actually started to unwind until I observed the bartender passing out roses and gave every woman in the restaurant a rose except for my wife and since we were the only African Americans there it didn't take long for us to jump to conclusions since we all were paying the same amount. But the food came out well

Portico's indoor space is somewhat small with many tables, so it tends to be very noisy. I have been just twice, but on both occasions the food was good but not outstanding, and was served at near room temperature. The thing that makes this place special is its outdoor patio, and when I return I will only do so when weather permits outdoor seating.
Having candidate interviews whether Breakfast or Dinner in Preston's Restaurant was very enjoyable.
What an amazing meal! I haven't been this excited about a dinner in a long time. Great assortment of fresh oysters, assorted wine list and knowledgeable wait staff.

column1: Regency Dining Room - The Hotel Roanoke & Conference Center
column13: They were very accommodating for our special occasion anniversary!

Have visited the Restaurant Pomme several times in the past five years. This is one of the best restaurants in the east. The food is always perfectly prepared. The taste is fantastic. The service is impecible. My wife and I always have a great evening when we dine at this restaurant!

column1: Rhett's River Grill and Raw Bar
column13: Ordered duck. It was almost raw. The server said "that's the way the chef makes it". I almost sent it back but didn't. I agree duck should not be overlooked but this was raw. You're better off at a Ruby Tuesday where the food is at least consistent.
Fine dining with the most accomadating service I have had in some time. My waiter was superb. The food was unparalleled. The entire expierence was sublime.

I think the restaurant had an off night we were there. We have had great experiences there over the years but not on 14 Feb 2013. Our waitress did not take our order until 15 minutes into the evening, and that was for drinks. We had to ask for the wine we ordered 3 times. My wife's soup was warmish but not hot, but she wasn't about to chance the delay waiting for it to be warmed up. My wife's meal was cold when she finally got it, 45 minutes after the wine had made its way to our table. Desert never made it and neither did the bill. We calculated what we owed and I left a tip; I did lose some serious points with my wife on that issue. Two tables left while we were there, never made it past drinks. However, Sweet Frog was great!

column4: 323 Water Street Suite A-1 Yorktown, VA  23690
column13: Excellent food, excellent service, excellent ambiance, excellent view
Food didn't seem up to usual quality. I am guessing with it being restaurant week the kitchen may have been overwhelmed.Won't keep us from coming back.Service was great as usual!
Nice place, the food was good, not great, if I had young kids it would be a regular stop. They've really brightened the place and it's very welcoming.
Ruth's Chris always does it right!

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Virginia Beach
column4: 205 Central Park Avenue Virginia Beach, VA  23462
column13: Always outstanding food and service. Pricey, but you get what you pay for. I think the wine list is overpriced, but everything else is worth the price.
portions unecessarily small, presentation good, taste quality not
A great place to have dinner !! Been there several times over the years.

column4: 1106 William Styron Square South Newport News, VA  23606
column13: Scallop appetizer came with 3 scallops. Prime rib was served cold, then I sent it back. It was the most tasteless steak I have ever had. For the 120 dollar bill Ruth's chris is way better. I will never go back to this restaurant
Average food quality. Service was spotty, but it was Valentine's day...

Our experience at Selba would be described as mediocre at best. There was a long wait for any attention from our waiter. Then, the pace of things picked up but the service was never at all attentive or personable. The food was nothing I would ever return for. The portions were quite small. Both of our entrees arrived cold and were not attractively presented in the least. The taste was dull and uninspired. Others may like this restaurant but we think there are many better restaurants in Richmond than Selba.
We recommend Shoemaker's because of their food but be prepared for a long wait.
Enjoyed the food and dessert was wonderful

column1: Shula's 347 Grill at the Marriott Norfolk Waterside
column13: This was a good experience. The staff were very friendly and knowledgable. I believe they helped to make my husband's birthday a great one.

column1: Shula's Steak House - Hilton Richmond Hotel & Spa
column13: Overall, the value was far below the cost.

column1: Sonoma Wine Bar & Bistro - Virginia Beach
column4: 189 Central Park Avenue Virginia Beach, VA  23462
column13: Fabulous food, outstanding service & lovely, lovely setting.
What an outstanding place!!! Great meal!!! Great Staff. Great night! Thank you!!!

This restaurant has been around since the 1930's, and while some of the decor was a little outdated, the dedication to service and good food is probably a big factor in why it is still around and successful. The food was excellent, the wait staff very attentive and sincere about the meal and our experience. I had the fried shrimp as an appetizer and plan to have them as a meal the next time. Some of the best shrimp I've ever had! Can't wait to come back when its warmer and enjoy a drink on the deck looking over the inlet.

column1: Surf Club Ocean Grille - Wyndham Oceanfront
column13: Went back for dinner. Again, I have to say the best view ever. Watched the sun set as we ate our dinner. The complimentary bread was amazing, none of us can stop thinking about it even while we had our main meal. My porkchops are in my all time top 3 of pork chops I've ever had. Also, was told the crab cake sandwich topped with a fried gren tomatoes was amazing and the angus burger was decent. The fries were unexpectedly addicting. Super thin shoestrings with awesome seasoning. Went on a Saturday night and still was only two other tables eating dinner. A hidden secret that needs to be discovered by all!

column4: 5641 Indian River Road Virginia Beach, VA  23464
column13: The Swan Terrace proved to be one of the best sit down dining establishment for a date night in Virginia Beach. From the moment you enter the facility the staff welcomes you and provide the best service.

The food was very good, with unique spices, sauces, and presentation. Some unusual options (like duck and side items). Service was also great. My only complaint was that the seating on the wall (a giant bench) was not comfortable and was far too low to the table (and I'm 6' tall).

We took a friend to Tarrant's for her birthday and had a very nice experience overall. The only slight disappointment was my entree, the seafood platter, which consisted of a crab cake, broiled fish, scallops and shrimp. It was good, but not great and certainly not what I expected from a $30 entree. Everyone else loved what they ordered. I tried my friend's shrimp and grits and wished that I had ordered it too. Monday nights are half-priced glasses of wine, which was a nice surprise. The service and atmosphere were good and combined with the food made for a very lovely evening for us all.
My wife ordered the Sherwood Farm Angus Cut and really enjoyed it.

column4: 120 B. East Main Street Charlottesville, VA  22902
column13: Food was good; place was was good and cozy.

column4: 3102 Holly Rd Suite 514 Virginia Beach, VA  23451
column13: My wife and I come here for special occasions because we consider Terrapin the best restaurant in VB. From the friendly greeting to the attentive service, we were treated very well. The wonderful flavors in the food are supported by the healthy, local ingredients. A great place to celebrate.

column4: 2105 W Great Neck Rd Virginia Beach, VA  23451
column13: Food, service, and ambiance were all great. Hostess was friendly and efficient. We will return.
My family and friends enjoyed our lunch at TJ's
Poor crab cakes. Very dry. No flavor.Prime Rib Steak, although advertised as 'the best', was outdone by Chile/Applebee's version.

column4: 150 West Main Street Suite 100 Norfolk, VA  23510
column13: A favorite special occasion restaurant for us. Outstanding food and impecable service. One of the very best restaurants in Hampton Roads.

column1: TradeWinds Restaurant - Virginia Beach Resort Hotel - Virginia Beach
column13: We went during restaurant week and enjoyed our visit. The food was excellent and the waiter was very attentive.We will return.
The food was outstanding as well as the wait staff.
I went for Restaurant Week. Great food and service. Interesting layout -- first floor.
The best fine dining restaurant I have ever been. I have been 5 time now and The Vintage Tavern never dissapoints!

Really good Italian food - such a surprise out in the middle of nowhere! Wines by the glass were only $6.00 and the chianti was very good. Service was very good, in a downhome way - don't expect upscale! Ambiance is definitely NOT upscale, so don't go looking for that, and be happy with the food!
Food was just "ok". Crab legs were not good. Waitress was very friendly and attentive.
The 2 dinners we had were excellent and we'll be back soon
First visit to Xtra's but not my last. Great menu, food and service. Will see you again soon.

The food is excellent but the service was awful. We were there for over 2 hours, had to physically get up from table to track down the waitress to ask for check and then had to physically take the check to the cashier and stand in the way of other waitresses to get it paid so we could leave.
my duck was so undercooked i could not chew it so it needed to be reheated and in doing so the presenation suffered and the vegtables became soggy. Others enjoyed their meals thoroughly.
Went there for an early Valentine's Day dinner. Everyone associated with Zoe's was very nice. We enjoyed our 2nd visit as much as the first. Great place to go for a special dinner.Neil and Sharon
